Add Atom feed to Jekyll powered blog

As you know Iâ€™ve recently migrated my blog from WordPress to Jekyll. One of the things I had to do was add an Atom feed(RSS sucks). It was quite the easy task. I just had to create an atom.xml file and place in the root of my blog.

Afterwards I only had to link my default layout to the atom feed:

<link rel="alternate" type="application/atom+xml" href="atom.xml"
title="Atom feed">

At this point I was able to subscribe to my new atom feed(and hopefully my followers(which I may or may not have) were able to do the same).
